tasks.title: Setup Project Repository
tasks.description: Create a new repository for the Auto Blog Post Generator project and initialize it with a basic directory structure.

subtasks.title: Create Project Directory
subtasks.description: Set up a new folder to contain the Auto Blog Post Generator project files.
subtasks.details: Use the command line to create a new directory (e.g., mkdir auto-blog-post-generator) and navigate into it (cd auto-blog-post-generator). Ensure the directory is named appropriately for the project.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the directory exists and is accessible by listing its contents.

subtasks.title: Initialize Git Repository
subtasks.description: Initialize a new Git repository within the project directory.
subtasks.details: Run git init inside the project directory to create an empty Git repository. Confirm that a .git folder is created.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check for the presence of the .git directory using ls -a or equivalent.

subtasks.title: Create .gitignore File
subtasks.description: Add a .gitignore file to specify files and directories that should be excluded from version control.
subtasks.details: Create a .gitignore file in the root of the project directory. Add common patterns such as node_modules/, .env, and any other files or folders that should not be tracked.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the .gitignore file exists and contains the correct patterns.

subtasks.title: Establish Basic Directory Structure
subtasks.description: Set up the initial directory structure for the project, including folders for source code, configuration, and documentation.
subtasks.details: Create directories such as src/, config/, and docs/ as needed for the project. Ensure the structure matches project conventions and requirements.
subtasks.testStrategy: List the contents of the project directory to confirm all required folders are present.

subtasks.title: Add README.md and Make Initial Commit
subtasks.description: Create a README.md file with basic project information and make the first commit to the repository.
subtasks.details: Write a README.md file describing the project purpose, setup instructions, and any relevant details. Stage all files (git add .), commit them (git commit -m 'Initial project setup'), and verify the commit history.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that README.md exists, git log shows the initial commit, and all intended files are tracked.

tasks.title: Install Required Libraries
tasks.description: Install necessary Python libraries such as LangChain for file management and other dependencies.

tasks.title: Implement Topic/Keyword-Based Post Generation
tasks.description: Develop a Python script to generate blog posts based on given topics or keywords.

tasks.title: Implement External Data-Based Post Generation
tasks.description: Create functionality to generate posts from external data sources like RSS, API, or CSV.

tasks.title: Automate Post Metadata Creation
tasks.description: Develop a feature to automatically write post metadata such as title, date, and tags.

tasks.title: Ensure Jekyll Compatibility
tasks.description: Ensure generated posts comply with Jekyll's file naming and formatting rules.

tasks.title: Implement Scheduling and Manual Execution
tasks.description: Add support for scheduling and manual execution of the script.

tasks.title: Test and Validate Generated Posts
tasks.description: Develop a test suite to validate the correctness and quality of generated posts.

tasks.title: Deploy and Integrate with Jekyll Blog
tasks.description: Deploy the script and integrate it with a Jekyll blog for automated posting.
